name: Boron
description: Trace mineral that supports bone health, hormone metabolism, and brain function. Increases free testosterone by reducing SHBG, supports vitamin D metabolism, and has anti-inflammatory properties. Often overlooked but increasingly recognized in longevity circles.
mechanisms: Bone health (reduces calcium and magnesium excretion)

dosage.notes: Boron citrate, glycinate, or fructoborate forms. Found in avocados, nuts, dried fruits. Very affordable. Take with meals.

keyFindings: Increased free testosterone by 28% and reduced estradiol in 1-week supplementation study
Reduced inflammatory markers (hs-CRP, TNF-α) within 1 week
Populations with low boron intake have higher arthritis prevalence
sideEffects: GI discomfort at very high doses
